Detailed Description

WidgetSwitcher that switches between two views, and has a factory from which these widgets are created.

You can either use the factory to create the widgets, or add them yourself. A WidgetSwitcher can only have two child widgets, of which only one is shown at a time.

The following is a simple example for WidgetSwitcher.

Before we create WidgetSwitcher, we need to implement our own WidgetFactory, and override makeWidget function:

 class MyWidgetFactory: public WidgetFactory {
 public:
   explicit MyWidgetFactory(WidgetSwitcherTest* mPage)
       : mpPage(mPage), mNum(0), mpImage1(NULL), mpImage2(NULL) {
       GLOGENTRY(LOG_TAG);
   }

   virtual ~MyWidgetFactory() {
       GLOG(LOG_TAG, LOGINFO, "~MyGalleryProvider");
       Widget *pDeleted = NULL;
       for (size_t i = 0; i < mWidgetPool.size(); i++) {
           pDeleted = const_cast<Widget *>(mWidgetPool.itemAt(i));
           delete pDeleted;
           pDeleted = NULL;
       }
       if (mpPage != NULL) {
           mpPage = NULL;
       }
   }

   virtual gaia::core::Widget* makeWidget() {
       GLOGENTRY(LOG_TAG);
       if (mNum == 0) {
           mNum++;
           mpImage1 = new ImageWidget(mpPage);
           GSAFETY_ON_NULL_RETURN_VAL(mpImage1, NULL);
           mWidgetPool.append(mpImage1);
           mpImage1->setImageResource(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a03);
           mpImage1->setScaleType(ImageWidget::FIT_CENTER);
           return mpImage1;
       } else {
           mpImage2 = new ImageWidget(mpPage);
           GSAFETY_ON_NULL_RETURN_VAL(mpImage2, NULL);
           mWidgetPool.append(mpImage2);
           mpImage2->setImageResource(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a07);
           mpImage2->setScaleType(ImageWidget::FIT_CENTER);
           return mpImage2;
       }
   }

 private:
   WidgetSwitcherTest *mpPage;
   int mNum;
   gaia::ui::ImageWidget* mpImage1;
   gaia::ui::ImageWidget* mpImage2;
   gaia::base::Vector<gaia::core::Widget *> mWidgetPool;
 };

After implement our own widget facotyr, we can start to create WidgetSwitcher and show in Page: 

 WidgetSwitcherTest::onInit(Persistence *savedInstanceState) {

     Scene* mpScene = Scene::SceneFactory(static_cast<Page*>(this));

     // Create a Layout.
     mpCtrl = new LinearController(static_cast<Page*>(this));
     mpCtrl->setOrientation(LinearController::VERTICAL);

     mplcp1 = new LinearControllerParams(ControllerParams::FILL_PARENT, ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT);
     // Create a widget factory which contents you want show on WidgetSwitcher.
     mpWidgetFactory = new MyWidgetFactory(this);

     // Set up WidgetSwitcher.
     mpWidgetSwitcher = new WidgetSwitcher(static_cast<Page*>(this));
     mpWidgetSwitcher->setControllerParams(mplcp1);

     // Sets content into WidgetSwitcher.
     mpWidgetSwitcher->setFactory(mpWidgetFactory);

     LinearController *pController = new LinearController(this);
     pController->addWidget(mpGallery);

     mpCtrl->addWidget(mpWidgetSwitcher);
     mpCtrl->addWidget(mpPrevBtn);
     mpCtrl->addWidget(mpNextBtn);

     mpScene->attachController(mpCtrl);
     mpScene->setupSceneLayout();
 }

 // Register the click listener.
 void WidgetSwitcherTest::onClick(gaia::core::Widget* v) {
   GLOGENTRY(LOG_TAG);
   switch (v->getId()) {
       case 1:
       {
           GLOG(LOG_TAG, LOGDBG, "Show previous image");
           mpWidgetSwitcher->showPrevious();
       }
       break;

       case 2:
       {
           GLOG(LOG_TAG, LOGDBG, "Show next image");
           mpWidgetSwitcher->showNext();
       }
       break;

       default:
           break;
   }
 }
